thread.title_full: In the Greater Phoenix Area? These Museums Have...

title: In the Greater Phoenix Area? These Museums Have...

locations.name: phoenix sky harbor international airport museum

text:
Phoenix Art Museum 
Where is it? PhoenixWhen is it free? Voluntary donation on the first Friday of the month from 6 p.m. to 10 p.m. in conjunction with First Friday ; voluntary donation on Wednesdays from 3 p.m. to 9 p.m.The permanent collection at Phoenix Art Museum includes more than 17,000 works of American, Asian, European, Latin American, modern/contemporary, Western American art, and Fashion Design. More » Fiesta Bowl Museum. © Judy Hedding Where is it? Downtown ScottsdaleWhen is it free? Admission is always freeThe Ellie and Michael Ziegler Fiesta Bowl Center and Museum opened in Scottsdale in October 2006. Memorabilia from Fiesta Bowl events and bowl games will help you relive the greatest moments in Fiesta Bowl history. More » Heard Museum in Phoenix. © Judy Hedding Heard Museum 
Where is it? PhoenixWhen is it free? The first Friday of every month, from 6 p.m. to 10 p.m. except in March ( in conjunction with First Friday ). Native Americans are always admitted free.In 1929 Dwight and Maie Heard established this location in what is now central Phoenix to house their personal art and artifacts collection. Today, the focus of the Heard Museum is both traditional and contemporary Native American art. There are more than 35,000 artifacts in its permanent collection at the Heard Museum, displayed in 10 exhibit galleries. Are you interested in knowing more about the Heard Museum? Watch the video! More » Mesa Arts Center. © Judy Hedding 
Where is it? Downtown MesaWhen is it free? Admission is always free.Five galleries showcasing contemporary art by emerging and internationally recognized artists, as well as art workshops. More » Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport Museum. © Judy Hedding 
Where is it? Phoenix, at Terminal 4, 3rd FloorWhen is it free? Admission is always free"Through the art collection, exhibitions and aviation archive, the Phoenix Airport Museum’s mission is to enhance the public’s experience by creating memorable environments in the airport system that promote Arizona's unique artistic and cultural heritage." 
Tip: You can get to Terminal 4 at the airport via the connection from METRO Light Rail to PHX Sky Train . PHX Sky Train has a station right at that terminal, on the 3rd floor. There is a fare required to use Light Rail, but PHX Sky train has no charge. More » Don't Stop Here!
